title: Wales make 13 changes to face Uruguay with Justin Tipuric named as captain
text:
Wales have chopped and changed their side as expected to face Uruguay on Sunday, which takes place four days after their victory over Fiji in Oita. Wales head coach Warren Gatland has made 13 changes, the most Wales have ever made at a Rugby World Cup.

The only remaining players from that 29-17 win over Fiji are centre Hadleigh Parkes and wing Josh Adams, who is named in the starting side despite suffering a knock to his leg against Fiji, after the Cardiff Blues winger had scored a hat-trick.

Justin Tipuric captains the side for the first time, the 14th player to lead Wales under Gatland, after being rested against Fiji.

Five players make their first appearances in this year’s tournament - hooker...
description: Wales have chopped and changed their side as expected to face Uruguay on Sunday, which takes place four days after their victory over Fiji in Oita.
